description:
The "new sibling romantic comedy" revolves around Masamune Izumi, a light novel author in high school. Masamune's little sister is Sagiri, a shut-in girl who hasn't left her room for an entire year. She even forces her brother to make and bring her meals when she stomps the floor. Masamune wants his sister to leave her room, because the two of them are each other's only family.

Masamune's novel illustrator, penname “Ero Manga Sensei,” draws extremely perverted drawings, and is very reliable. Masamune had never met his illustrator, and figured he was just a disgusting, perverted otaku. However, the truth is revealed … that his “Ero Manga Sensei” is his own younger sister! To add to the chaos that erupts between the siblings, a beautiful, female, best-selling shoujo manga creator becomes their rival!

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description: __Suzuki Kazutomo (鈴木一智)__ is a Japanese animation planner.

Tsukasa Fushimi  entered the first volume of Jūsanbanme no Alice into the 12th Dengeki Novel Prize in 2005. While the work did not win a prize, it survived through the third selection process and was ultimately published by ASCII Media Works under their Dengeki Bunko imprint in 2006 as Fushimi's debut work. Jūsanbanme no Alice ended with volume four in 2007.

Fushimi began writing the first novel of Ore no Imōto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai (Oreimo), published in 2008. By the time Oreimo ended with volume 12 in 2013, it has sold over 5 million copies and spawned a media franchise encompassing multiple manga, anime and video game adaptations. In 2013, Fushimi began his next novel series Eromanga Sensei.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)
A Japanese animator formerly affiliated with [GAINAX](https://anilist.co/studio/6).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanzakihiro) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLww4xTaLWjpESsK2HzkkcA) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/1159685/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/27557) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-658062794)

Animator, illustrator and composer.

Uses the pen name Hanasoumen-P (鼻そうめんP) or HSP for his Vocaloid work.

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/km_straightedge)

Kazuma Miki is a Japanese light novel editor. He is President of Straight Edge, Editor-in-Chief of LINE Novel, and Outside Director of EGG FIRM.
Masaharu Yamanouchi is a music producer.
Ryouko Nashimoto is a recording engineer.

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)
